0:
# Enable AOF https://redis.io/topics/persistence#append-only-file
appendonly yes
# Disable RDB persistence, AOF persistence already enabled.
save ""
maxmemory 188743680
maxmemory-policy allkeys-lru

[ups-1]
  driver = usbhid-ups
  port = auto
  # pollinterval = 15
  desc = "APC Back-UPS Pro 1500"
  # vendorid = "051D"
  # productid = "0002"
  product = "Back-UPS RS 1500G FW:865.L9 .D USB FW:L9"
  serial = "4B2107P01305"
  # vendor = "American Power Conversion"
  # bus = "001"
# [ups-2]
#   driver = snmp-ups
#   privProtocol=AES
#   port = 192.168.3.82
#   desc = "APC Smart-UPS 750"
# [ups-3]
#   driver = snmp-ups
#   privProtocol=AES
#   port = 192.168.3.83
#   desc = "APC Smart-UPS 750"

[admin]
  password = secret
  actions = SET
  instcmds = ALL
  upsmon master
[upsmon]
  password = secret
  upsmon slave

MONITOR ups-1@localhost 1 admin secret master
SHUTDOWNCMD "/sbin/shutdown -h +0"
POWERDOWNFLAG /etc/killpower
POLLFREQ 15
POLLFREQALERT 5
HOSTSYNC 15

/hr/oci--registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicha.title: external-dns helm release
/hr/oci--registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicha.name: external-dns
/hr/oci--registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicha.doc: ExternalDNS is a Kubernetes add-on that automatically manages the creation and updates of DNS records for services running in your cluster. It integrates with a variety of DNS providers, such as CloudFlare DNS, Amazon Route 53, Google Cloud DNS, and more, to ensure that your applications are easily accessible from anywhere with a DNS name. With ExternalDNS, you can simplify the process of managing DNS records for your home lab, eliminating the need for manual updates and reducing the risk of errors.

0: bad ingress config - nginx config test failed
ssl certificate(s) will expire in less then a week
uninstall the latest ingress changes to allow config reloads to resume
renew expiring certificates to avoid downtime
More than 35% of all requests returned 5XX, this requires your attention

/hr/oci--registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicha.title: redis helm release
/hr/oci--registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicha.name: redis
/hr/oci--registry-1.docker.io-bitnamicha.doc:
Redis is an open-source, in-memory data structure store that is used as a database, cache, and message broker. It provides a fast and flexible solution for storing and retrieving data, making it an ideal choice for a wide range of use cases, including real-time analytics, session management, and more.

Redis is used by Authentik, Authelia, oauth2-proxy.

/hr/lkmgr.github.io-charts-app-template-.title: home-assistant helm release
/hr/lkmgr.github.io-charts-app-template-.name: home-assistant
/hr/lkmgr.github.io-charts-app-template-.doc:
Home Assistant

Home Assistant is a home automation platform that has many integrations. It can be used to control lights, fans, thermostats, cameras, and many other devicesn
